column4: Can someone let me remotely view their desktop?  I want to see how well VNC works over the Internet. You don't have to give me control of your desktop.
vnc is slow and sluggish regardless of over the internet or on a LAN
isn't it just bandwidth that slows it down?
and in any case, what alternative do you have that is faster?
I let q0_0p view my desktop yesterday. Now I want to view someone's desktop to see how it works
Doesn't VNC work by simply getting the X-window server to send the data over the network?
that's the best way to do it, surely

I was using a hardware firewall (router) before.  In fact, two connected in series.  But I forwarded some ports specifically to my computer to bypass the routers and set up a software firewall to re-establish the net.  My God!
i'm watching my daughters. i don't have the time to do a howto in more detail.
but so far as we can tell his new ubuntu install doesn't know that sda6 exits
But there ought to be an option to refuse messages from randoms
